Key Match Events: Zebby Matthews gave up nine runs off 10 hits in an outing that lasted just two innings.
George Springer hit a two-run homer to put Toronto up 2-0.
Spencer Horwitz hit a 381-foot shot to right field that made it 4-0.
Leo Jimenez hit a two-run single to make it 7-0 lead for the Blue Jays.
Addison Barger hit a two-run shot in the second inning that extended the Blue Jays advantage to 9-0.
The Blue Jays scored four off Kyle Farmer in the eighth and ninth innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Zebby Matthews said, 'It's obviously very frustrating, you know, my job is to go out there and give the team the best chance to win. I didn't do that (Saturday), so it's obviously very frustrating.'

Twins manager Rocco Baldelli said, 'Zebby is going to be fine. You're gonna deal with this at some point. So there's no good time to deal with it, there's no right time to deal with it, but when the time comes and you run into the game that he ran into (Saturday), you think about ways that you don't allow it to snowball and get out of control.'
Kyle Farmer picked up the Twins' bullpen by pitching a pair of innings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Toronto batters turned 23 hits into 15 runs, both season highs for the team.
The Twins still have a chance to win their three-game series against the Blue Jays in their series finale on Sunday.
